metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35704 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the FSTLEB128 varint functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fstfile can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open amalicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concernsthe fstReaderVarint32WithSkip function.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
